column4: can anyone else apt-get update from any archive without getting a bunch of 403s?
sure
which archive?
a mixture of the french and italian ones, currently
which repositories are you using?
i mean with mirrors. try using some others
s/with/which/
tried us.archive, archive, se.archive, among others, but not working
do you have a (DSL) router?
yes
look at your /etc/resolv.conf -- is your router set as the DNS server?
nameserver 192.168.0.1 (the router)
right. try changing that into 212.245.255.2, and then try again the apt-get update
(that IP's a DNS server that i know works)
still 403s
if i copy/paste the urls into firefox, i get the lists

hmm, ok. i'll explain why i asked you to do this --- some guy had encountered a problem with 403s and other errors on apt-get, due to the fact that his router model messed up DNS when requests came too fast. that's why i had you try another server
can you paste both your sources.list and the errors you're getting from apt-get update to the pastebin?
please hold...
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16489
well, i can confirm that your sources.list works for me
i've seen that man ;-) i'm looking at it, as i said, it works for me, and i'm not sure what could be wrong
my bad, was gutting another machine for something else
well, i can honestly say i don't have a clue. you should probably purge/clean your list of packages, but i don't know and can't find the right command for that.
